Simple.Name: argument
Simple.Description: depending on the context could be an absolute path, or a relative path, or a file name, or a regex.

Named.Name: BaseDirectory
Named.Description: directory to use as starting point. Defaults to current directory

Simple.Name: SourceRoot
Simple.Description: Optional value that defines what portion of the base folder should be treated as the source root; the portion of the tree below this root will be replicated as-is within the DestinationRoot; defaults to base dir

Flag.Name: NameRegex
Flag.Description: argument is name-regex; each entry's name should be checked against it
Specify this flag to treat the argument as a name-regex: only the NAME of each will be checked against it, not the whole path

Flag.Name: PathRegex
Flag.Description: Specify this flag to treat the argument as a path-regex: the whole path of each entry will be checked against it

Flag.Name: r
Flag.Description: search AND copy recursively from base directory

Flag.Name: e
Flag.Description: Print a description of the arguments received, for debugging purposes

Flag.Name: debug
Flag.Description: Attempt to launch the default debugger before running

Flag.Name: watch
Flag.Description: Create a watch for modified files in the 'base' directory and copy them in the target ('argument') directory. The process will keep on running until killed externally or by using the Ctrl+C shortcut.

Flag.Name: v
Flag.Description: Prints a line to report each successfully copied file

Flag.Name: help
Flag.Description: Print a short guide. if this argument is specified, all other arguments (beside -debug and -e) will be ignored and the program will terminate
